oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: L. G. Derthick correspondence with Raymond B. Witt, 1955 November 17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Derthick, Lawrence G.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter authored by superintendent of Chattanooga public schools, Lawrence G. Derthick, suggesting that the school board might consider postponing public hearings regarding school integration until a plan of action to address the public is devised.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education correspondence and memoranda, 1955-1957
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1953-1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
